request.description:
This method returns a list of selected placement labels.

You need to parse PlacementId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Services/Label/PlacementLabels?placementIds=00000

You can retrieve PlacementId using "GET Placements" method.

This method sets labels for selected placements.

You need to parse PlacementIds in your request body.

You can retrieve PlacementId using "GET Placements" method.

This method returns a list of all placements that belong to a specified campaign's active mediaplan.

You have to parse CampaignId parameter on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Placement/Placements?CampaignId=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns".

This method creates a new placement and adds it to an active media plan in your specified campaign.

You have to parse CampaignId in your request body.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns".

This method updates an existing placement.

You have to parse PlacementId in your request body.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Placements".

This method returns placement schedule information.

You have to parse PlacementId in your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Placement/PlacementSchedules?PlacementIds=11111

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Placements".

This method updates Placement Schedule.

You need to parse PlacementId in your request URL.

You can retrieve PlacementId using method "GET Placements"

This method returns placement comment information.

You need to parse PlacementId in your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Placement/PlacementComments?PlacementIds=11111

You can retrieve PlacementId using "GET Placements" method.

This method returns placement comment information.

You need to parse PlacementId in your request body.

You can retrieve PlacementId using "GET Placements" method.

This method returns line items available in user's agency scope. In order to access line items, user should have granted access to agency campaigns.

At least one campaign, order, line item or placement identifier should be specified.

Filtering parameter names:
1. campaignIds (comma separated list of campaign identifiers)
2. orderIds (comma separated list of order identifiers)
3. lineitemIds (comma separated list of line item identifiers/0
4. placementIds (comma separated list of placement identifiers)
5. types (comma separated list of line item types. Available values: Display, Mobile, Video)
6. fields (comma separated list of fields to return in response. Available values: 
Id, PlacementId, OrderId, CampaignId, AgencyId, Name, Type, Budget)
7. paused (filter by paused attribute)
8. deleted (fiter by deleted attribute)
9. search (search by line item name)
10. sort (comma separated sort settings, e.g. sort=id+asc,name+desc. Available fields for sorting: id, name)
11. offset (Starting index of items to return. Default value = 0)
11. limit (Default value = 100)

Example: /v1/buyer/rtb/lineitems?campaignIds=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method returns a specific RTB line item.

You need to parse CampaignId and ActivityId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Activities?campaignId=00000&ActivityId=11111

This method creates a new RTB Line Item.

You need to parse CampaignId in your request body and specify at least one inventory.

Inventory specification includes InventorySourceId and SourceId.

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve information about inventories using "GET Inventory Sources" method.

More info about line item creation: 
http://api.adform.com/help/references/buyer-solutions/line-item/rtb/management/create-line-item

This method updates an existing RTB Line Item.

You need to specify ActivityId,CampaignId and PlacementId in your request body.

EXAMPLE: "Id": 11111, "CampaignId": 00000, "PlacementId": 2222222
(Id stand for ActivityId).

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method deletes a specified RTB Line Item.

You need to parse CampaignId and ActivityId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Activities?campaignId=00000&ActivityId=11111

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve ActivityId "GET RTB Line Items" method.

This method returns detailed information about creative settings for specified inventory.

You need to parse source ID, source type and parent source ID on your request URL.

Example: /v1/creativesettings?sourceid=780&sourcetype=1&parentsourceid=780

This method returns classificators list for specified type.

You need to parse "type" parameter on your request URL.

Type can be bannertype, richmediasubtype, iabcategory and etc.

Example: /v1/creativesettings/classificator/xxxx
(where xxxx is type)

This method returns a list of available inventory sources.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Activities/InventorySources?campaignId=11111

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method returns a list of available inventory sources..

You can filter inventory sources using these parameters:
1. mustHaveDeals (default is true)
2. mustSupportManualDeals (default is false)

This method returns a list of available deals and packages.

You need to parse CampaignId and InventorySourceId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /Activities/DealsAndPackages?campaignId=00000&inventorySourceId=XXX

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve InventorySourceId using "GET Inventory Sources" method.
This method returns a list of valid deals that are accessible for agency.
This method creates marketplace manual deal.

item.name: Deal Info (for PMP, external and manual deals)

request.description:
This returns information about specified deal.

You need to parse parent source ID, source type and source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/deals/x/y/z
(where x - parent source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

Available source type values:
3 - PMP deal
5 - external deal
6 - manual deal

This method updates deal state for client division.

You need to parse parent source ID, source type and source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/deals/x/y/z
(where x - parent source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

Source type values:
3 - PMP deal
5 - external deal
6 - manual deal

Deal state values:
2 - Accepted
3 - Rejected

item.name: All Inventories (campaign or line item scope)

request.description:
This method returns a list of available inventories for a specified campaign or line item.

Please note that either CampaignId or ActivityId is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview/available?campaignid=000000

item.name: Search inventories (campaign or line item scope)

request.description:
This method returns a list of available inventories for a specified campaign or line item and matches specified filter parameters.

Please note that either CampaignId or ActivityId is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview?campaignid=000000

More info about search parameters: 
http://api.adform.com/v1/help/buyer/inventories#!/InventoriesOverview/InventoriesOverview_GetList

This method returns detailed information about specified inventory.

Please note that parent source ID, source type, source ID and campaign or activity ID is required on your request URL.

Example: /v1/inventoriesoverview/x/y/z?campaignId=0000
(where x - parnt source ID, y - source type, z - source ID)

This method returns logo for specified inventory sources. Content value is returned as Base64 string.

You need to parse inventory source ID on your request URL.

Example: /dsp/v1/inventoriesoverview/logos/?id=1
This method returns Trading Desk Fee Change Log.
This method returns default targeting settings for a new line item.

This method returns RTB Line Item targeting settings.

You need to parse ActivityId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /dsp/v1/activities/11111/targeting
(11111 - ActivityId)

This method updates RTB Line Item targeting settings.

You need to parse ActivityId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /dsp/v1/activities/11111/targeting
(11111 - ActivityId)

This method is for cookie upload. Cookies are read from the request body.

IMPORTANT: Request body should be sent as plain text, cookies separated by new line.

This method is for advertising Ids upload. Advertising Ids are read from the request body.


IMPORTANT: Request body should be sent as plain text, advertising Ids (GUIDs) separated by new line.

This method is for IP ranges upload. IP ranges are read from the request body.

IMPORTANT: Request body should be sent as plain text, IP ranges separated by new line.

This method returns a list of locations for targeting.

You can use filtering parameters (which are optional) with such key names:

1. term
2. filter (search term. Optional. Filters the result list to return service providers where name matches term)
3. limit (limits the result amount, default is 100, to get all results use 0)
4. startIndex (default value is 0. Optional. Defines start index, from which element to start)

Example: /v1/dictionaries/locations?limit=0

This method returns a list of languages for targeting.

You can use filtering parameters (which are optional) with such key names:

1. term
2. filter (search term. Optional. Filters the result list to return service providers where name matches term)
3. limit (limits the result amount, default is 100, to get all results use 0)
4. startIndex (default value is 0. Optional. Defines start index, from which element to start)

Example: /v1/dictionaries/languages?limit=0

This method returns a list of available tracking points for targeting.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /dictionaries/trackingPoints?campaignId=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can also use filtering parameters (which are optional) with such key names:

1. term
2. filter (search term. Optional. Filters the result list to return service providers where name matches term)
3. limit (limits the result amount, default is 100, to get all results use 0)
4. startIndex (default value is 0. Optional. Defines start index, from which element to start)

Example: /v1/dictionaries/trackingPoints?campaignId=00000&limit=0

4. startIndex (default value is 0. Optional. Defines start index, from which element to start)

Example: /v1/dictionaries/trackingPointFilters?campaignId=00000&limit=0

This method returns a list of available engagements for targeting.

This method returns a list of available external data providers for targeting.

You need to parse CampaignId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /dictionaries/externalDataProviders?campaignId=00000

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

This method returns a list of available categories and segments for the specified external data provider.

You need to parse CampaignId and DataProviderId on your request URL.

EXAMPLE: /dictionaries/externalDataCategories?campaignId=00000&dataProviderId=11111

You can retrieve CampaignId using "GET Campaigns" method.

You can retrieve ProviderId using "GET External Data Providers" method.
